Problem:
Consider the behavior of a system governed by a set of linear differential equations \(\dot{x} = Dx\), where \(D\) is a diagonalizable constant matrix. Investigate the effects of applying a transformation defined by the complex function \( g(x) = e^{i\omega t}x \) on the system, with \(\omega\) representing a real constant frequency.

Can we ascertain the initial state vector \( x_0 \) after observing \( x(t) \) at \( t = T \) without knowing whether \( g(x) \) was applied?
Explanation: The influence of the transformation \( g(x) = e^{i\omega t}x \) modifies the initial state and could make it difficult or impossible to retrieve \( x_0 \) without knowledge of whether the transformation was applied, due to its complex exponential influence on the trajectory.
